result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah M. Smith Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  May Not have contact with Judith Osban or Kristen Cowfer unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: PT
Court takes judicial notice of JOC in 09CF1206. State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.  
Counts 1 & 3 - Defendant is sentenced to 10 years in the WSP forthwith; 5 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years of Extended Supervision. Counts 1 & 3 are concurrent to each other.  DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  No contact with Judith O. or Kristen C.     
Counts 2 & 4 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years concurrent to each other, but Consecutive to Counts 1 & 3.  Conditions are the same as conditions of extended supervision.   Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Court has reviewed letter from DE and no action is taken.
from DE.

Exhibits from jury trial, State Exhibits 1 through 10.
Exhibits 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, and 10 received by the clerk.  Exhibit 5 (shoe lift impression) and Exhibit 9 (pair of shoes) returned to KPD Det. Keith Dumesic following the trial at the request of ADA Binger.
Exhibits S1-S4, S7, S8 and S10 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 2/19/16. vm
from Miranda-Goodchild Hearing prior to the jury trial.  State Exhibits 1 and 2.

Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - Guilty
Count 3 - Guilty
Count 4 - Guilty
Question from the jury at 3:45 p.m.
filed by ADA Thomas Binger for the State
State's List of Exhibits
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Aileen Henry.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Henry requests a competency evaluation for the defendant; request denied by the Court at this time.  Def. indicates he wants to waive his right to counsel and go to jury trial without counsel, but def. refuses to fill out the Waiver of RIght to Counsel form.  Case will proceed to trial with Atty Henry representing the def.  Miranda Goodchild hearing held; KPD Det. Keith Dumesic testified on behalf of the State.  Court finds def. waived his right to remain silent when giving his statement on 10/24/13.  Voir dire from 9:30 a.m. to 10:10 a.m.; 13 jurors selected.  Trial commenced at 10:25 a.m. with instructions read to the jury by the Court.  Opening statements by counsel.  State witnesses testified:  K.C., J.O., KPD Det. Brian Miller, KPD Officer Martin Howard, and KPD Officer Brandie Pie.  Break for lunch at 11:52 a.m.  Trial resumed at 1:15 p.m. with testimony of KPD criminalist Todd Thorne and KPD Det. Keith Dumesic.  State rests at 2:30 p.m.  Break taken.  Defense rests at 2:49 p.m. without presenting evidence or testimony.  Jury instructions read to the jury by the Court.   Closing arguments by counsel.  Deliberations began at 3:14 p.m.; verdict reached at 3:56 p.m.  Verdicts of guilty on all 4 counts; judgment entered on the verdicts.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 3/28/16 at 10:30.  Bond continued.
from DE

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Aileen Henry.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Cases are not resolved.  Atty Henry's motion to withdraw as counsel is denied at this time.  Case remains on for jury trial 2/15/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
Defendant's Attorney's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Aileen Henry.
Per confirmation with Atty Henry; Jury Trial rescheduled to 2/15/16 at 8:30 AM with a Jury Status on 2/11/16 at 1:00 PM.  Atty Henry to provide notice to the defendant.
Court has reviewed and approves Atty Henry's request to reschedule trial on 11/16/15 at 8:30 AM.
